title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, the system should confirm that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Currently, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new project for an existing directory structure.
2. Point the output folder at a bin directory.
3. Verify if the system confirms that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
